title: Hong Kong firefighters break into burning flat to rescue elderly woman
text:
Hong Kong firefighters break into burning flat to rescue elderly woman 
Victim suffered injuries to arms and legs; at least two other residents hurt in blaze  29pm  29pm Print Email 
Firefighters broke into a burning flat in Tung Chung, Lantau and rescued an elderly woman before flames gutted the unit on Monday morning. 
At least two other residents were injured in the blaze that broke out in the 25th-floor flat at Kui Yat House in Yat Tung Estate on Chung Yan Road. 
Nine fire engines and three ambulances were sent to the scene after the Fire Services Department received a call at 9.33am. 
Police said about 50 residents were evacuated from the public housing block. 
“An old lady was rescued from the burning unit. She was in a conscious state, suffering injuries to her arms and legs,” a police spokesman said. 
An online video clip showed there were fierce flames in the burning unit, with black smoke billowing from the windows. 
Firefighters used a water jet to battle the blaze, taking about half an hour to extinguish it. 
One dead and two injured in Sham Shui Po fire 
The fire damaged the flat’s windows and blackened the outer walls and windows of units on the floors above. 
A government spokesman said three people were injured in the blaze, and two of them were sent to North Lantau Hospital in Tung Chung for treatment. 
At about 11.30am, the affected floors remained cordoned off as police and fire department staff continued their investigation. 
Both departments said officers were still investigating the cause of the blaze.
